textBeforeTable: Recommended releases Downloads Drupal 7 only has built-in support for non-external libraries via hook_library(). But it is only suitable for drupal.org projects that bundle their own library; i.e., the module author is the creator and vendor of the library. Libraries API should be used for externally developed and distributed libraries. A simple example would be a third-party jQuery plugin. "plugins") that are neither shipped nor packaged with a project on drupal.org. We do not want to host third-party libraries on drupal.org for a multitude of reasons, starting with licensing, proceeding to different release cycles, and not necessarily ending with fatal errors due to conflicts of having the same library installed in multiple versions. Denotes libraries ( External libraries This module introduces a common repository for libraries in sites/all/libraries resp. sites/<domain>/libraries for contributed modules. The common denominator for all Drupal modules/profiles/themes that integrate with external libraries.
